nodes.text: Star Wars Epic Yarns: Return of the Jedi

Star Wars Epic Yarns: Return of the Jedi is a non-canon title in the new Star Wars Epic Yarns series that presents the story of the classic Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi as if the characters and situations were made of yarn or felt. The book is authored by Jack Wang and Holman Wang.

Jedi apprentices and little princesses will delight in this (heart)felt retelling of the Star Wars saga. And so will Star Wars fans of any age! The series launches with the original trilogy, and every word counts in these small but perfectly formed yarns. That's because each volume features 12 iconic scenes, handcrafted in felt and pithily summarized in just a single word. The attention to detail is eye-opening; the proportions are just-right for small hands; the fun is guaranteed.
The monster Jabba is encountered, C-3PO conducts story time, and there is a happy ending.

The story of Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi is presented in twelve words, as well as scenes on the front and back cover, the back cover scene presenting a quotation from the film. The scenes shown are:
